intro: Maytenus somalensis, commonly known as the Somali mayten, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences, followed by small, spherical fruits. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in local medicine for their potential medicinal properties. The species is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
